description: Reverse one number (0), then two numbers (2,1), then three (5,4,3), then four (9,8,7,6), etc.
comments: a(n) is the smallest nonnegative integer not yet in the sequence such that n + a(n) is one less than a square. [From _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Apr 06 2009]
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
prog: (PARI) default(realprecision, 100); for (n=0, 1000, f=floor(sqrt(2*n + 1) - 1/2); write("b061579.txt", n, " ", f*(f + 2) - n) ) \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 25 2009
crossrefs: Fixed points are A046092. Each reversal involves the numbers from A000217 through to A000096.
A self-inverse permutation of the nonnegative numbers.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 21 2001
